message.content:
To get to the grocery store that is 1km away in Turkmenistan, you have a few transportation options:

1. Walking: If the weather permits and you are physically able, walking can be a convenient and healthy option. Simply follow the route to the grocery store on foot.

2. Cycling: If you have a bicycle or can rent one, cycling can be a faster way to reach the grocery store. Turkmenistan has some cycling lanes and paths, so make sure to follow the designated routes.

3. Public Transportation: Turkmenistan has a public transportation system, including buses and minibusses called "marshrutkas." Check for the nearest bus stop or marshrutka station, and take a bus that goes in the direction of the grocery store. Ask locals or use a transportation app to find the appropriate route.

4. Taxi: Taxis are widely available in Turkmenistan. You can either hail a taxi on the street or use ride-hailing apps if they are available in your area. Inform the driver of your destination, and they will take you directly to the grocery store.

Remember to consider factors such as cost, convenience, and personal preference when choosing your mode of transportation.
